results.title: Little Tom Thumb (K)
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: The dream of escaping from poverty and unhappiness comes true when Little Tom Thumb becomes a hero - saving himself and his six big brothers, and returning home with treasure and magic boots. Animation by Harold Whitaker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joy Batchelor, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: Little Tim and the brave sea captain (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This film captures the feel of salt in a seaside village and the rigours of shipboard life through the adventures of Tim, a gallant stowaway. The sweeping power of the wild ocean and angry sky, and a swirl of greens and greys are forcefully projected while lively sea shanties and the call of gulls accent the storytelling. Based on the well known children’s book by Edward Ardizzone.

results.title: Little skills mean a lot
results.brief_description: Leading sports commentator, Sandy Roberts introduces the Australian Football skills and drills film, highlighting the LITTLE things in football which are essential for team success. Skills drills on tackling, smothering, evasion, ball-handling, crumb gathering, kicking to position etc are presented by leading Victorian Junior Coach, Ray ‘Slug’ Jordan and VFL Development Manager, Kevin Sheehan.

results.title: Little man - big city
results.creator_credit: Gyorgy Varnia, Gyula Macskassy, Roman Kunz, MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description: An animated film which dramatises the plight of today’s urban dweller. Shows the city’s relentless assault on the health of its inhabitants. The `little man’ lives in a typical urban centre where poor planning, haphazard design and inadequate health controls have depleted him - emotionally and physically. The film urges united action to make cities healthy and enjoyable places in which to live.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gyorgy Varnia, Gyula Macskassy, Roman Kunz, MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio and World Health Organisation

results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: Andrew Morgan, Richard Callanan and BBC
results.brief_description: Twelve year-old Cedric Erroll’s world is turned upside down when, completely unexpectedly, a lawyer from London arrives with the news that he is the grandson and rightful heir to the vast lands and fortunes of the Earl of Dorincourt. So, Little Lord Fauntleroy and his mother leave their humble New York abode to live in a castle in England. However, he soon finds that money doesn’t necessarily bring happiness. His bitter and often cruel grandfather refuses to allow Cedric’s mother into his home. Starring Michael Benz as Cedric, George Baker of Inspector Wrexford fame as the Earl of Dorincourt and Betsy Brantley as Cedric’s mother. A triumph of good over bad, the new world over the old, this timeless story has captured the hearts of both children and adults alike for generations. Based on the novel by Frances Hodges Burnett.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

results.title: Little golden memories
results.creator_credit: Jim Bousman and Western Publishing Company
results.brief_description: Stories from twelve of the best loved Little Golden Books. - Poky little puppy and the patchwork blanket. - Theodore Mouse goes to sea. - Tawny scrawny lion. - Sailor dog. - Rupert the rhinoceros. - Jack and the beanstalk. - Saggy baggy elephant. - Little toad to the rescue. - Scruffy the tugboat. - Three Billy Goats Gruff. - Little Red Riding Hood. - What was that?
